INGREDIENTS:

 • Fish – 500g (cut into medium-sized pieces) 
 • Oil – 6 tbsp
 • Fennel seeds – ½ tsp
 • Onion – 2 big
 • Tomato – 2
 • Ginger garlic paste – 3 tsp
 • Kashmiri chilli powder – 3/4 tsp
 • Red chilli powder – ½ tsp (optional) 
 • Green Chilli – 2
 • Turmeric powder – ½ tsp
 • Coriander powder – 1 tsp
 • Garam masala – ½ tsp
 • Water – 1/2 cup
 • Curry leaves – few
 • Salt


TO MARINATE: 
 • Chilli powder – 1 tsp
 • Kashmiri chilli powder – 1 tsp
 • Turmeric powder – ½ tsp
 • Ginger garlic paste – 2 tsp
 • Lemon juice – 2 tsp
 • Salt

 METHOD: 
 1. Mix all the ingredients to marinate. Add little water into it and make it to a paste. 
 2. Add fish pieces into it and keep it marinated for some time (Approx 30 min) 
 3. Heat oil in a nonstick pan and roast the marinated fish in a low-medium heat until its golden brown in colour. 
 4. Heat oil in a pan and splutter fennel seeds. 
 5. Add sliced onion, curry leaves. Keep the pan covered and stir in between till onion becomes brown in color ( It takes 15-20 mins for this) 
 6. Add sliced tomato and sauté till it becomes soft. 
 7. Add ginger garlic paste, green chilli and sauté for a min or two. 
 8. Add all masala, salt and sauté for a min or two. 
 9. Add 1/2 cup of water and allow it to boil. 
 10. Add roasted fish pieces and gently put the gravy over the fish pieces. 
 11. Keep the pan covered and cook for another 5-6 min in low flame. 
 12. Pour 2 tbsp of oil on the top. Keep the pan covered for some time.
